Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Animal, Plant, Rock

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an Entity that exists in the world.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int age
      The number of cycles in which the Entity has existed in the world for.
      protected int clock
      A variable used to keep track of whether or not the Entity has moved during the world's current cycle.
      protected boolean isAlive
      A boolean value that states whether or not an Entity is still alive.
      protected Location location
      The location in the world where the Entity is located.
      protected World world
      The world in which the Entity exists in.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entity(World world, Location location)
      Creates a new Entity in the given world and location.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void act()
      All non-abstract subclasses should have an act() method which allows them to do something during each cycle or iteration.
      int getAge()
      Gets the number of cycles in which the Entity has existed in the world for.
      abstract char getChar()
      All non-abstract subclasses should have a getChar() method.
      int getClock()
      Gets the clock of the Entity, which is used to determine whether or not the Entity moved during the current cycle or iteration.
      Location getLocation()
      Gets the location where the Entity is located in the world.
      World getWorld()
      Gets the world where the Entity exists in.
      boolean isAlive()
      Gets the living status of the Entity.
      void removeSelfFromWorld()
      Removes the Entity from the world.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • world

        protected World world
        The world in which the Entity exists in.

      • location

        protected Location location
        The location in the world where the Entity is located.

      • age

        protected int age
        The number of cycles in which the Entity has existed in the world for.

      • isAlive

        protected boolean isAlive
        A boolean value that states whether or not an Entity is still alive.

      • clock

        protected int clock
        A variable used to keep track of whether or not the Entity has moved during the world's current cycle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(World world,
              Location location)
        Creates a new Entity in the given world and location. Initiates the Entity's age to 0, its isAlive field to true, and its clock to its world's clock.
        Parameters:
        world - The world in which the Entity exists in.
        location - The location in the world where the Entity is located.

    • Method Detail

      • getWorld

        public World getWorld()
        Gets the world where the Entity exists in.
        Returns:
        this Entity's world.

      • getLocation

        public Location getLocation()
        Gets the location where the Entity is located in the world.
        Returns:
        this Entity's location.

      • getAge

        public int getAge()
        Gets the number of cycles in which the Entity has existed in the world for.
        Returns:
        this Entity's age.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Gets the living status of the Entity.
        Returns:
        this Entity's isAlive field. If it is true, then the Entity is still alive. Otherwise, it is not.

      • getClock

        public int getClock()
        Gets the clock of the Entity, which is used to determine whether or not the Entity moved during the current cycle or iteration.
        Returns:
        this Entity's clock.

      • act

        public abstract void act()
        All non-abstract subclasses should have an act() method which allows them to do something during each cycle or iteration.

      • getChar

        public abstract char getChar()
        All non-abstract subclasses should have a getChar() method.
        Returns:
        the character representation of this Entity in the world when printed in the terminal.

      • removeSelfFromWorld

        public void removeSelfFromWorld()
        Removes the Entity from the world. It removes itself from its world's map so it can no longer be referenced by the world. It also sets its isAlive status to false.
